articles.title: About Us
articles.contents:
I (Melina) founded this group to be a collaborative space meant to cross the bridges of Political Science subfields to connect folks who are wanting or are actively using quantitative methods in their work. Our goals for the group are to reduce barriers and encourage the use of quantitative methods while recognizing that Political Methodology’s history as a subfield has lacked diversity and accessibility to womxn and POC.
We are looking to leverage our collective knowledge to teach each other general methods, coding hacks, and tricks to make all of our lives easier. This space will use R, as R’s open nature allows for everyone to access the software with no financial barriers. Along with presenting coding help and tips, we also hold the space to read and discuss big issues/articles in Political Methodology.

articles.title: Blog
articles.contents: Check back in soon for blog posts by UCI P.S. Graduate Students!

articles.title: UCI Political Methodology Group
articles.description: Welcome to the website of the UCI Political Science Methods and Coding group, also known as UCI's Political Methodology working group. Here you will find a scheule of our meetings, Github links, and information on our Summer R Stats Bootcamp. This group was founded by Melina Much, Ph.D. Student, and is co-organized with Liz Muehlemann Ph.D. Student.

articles.contents:
uci_polmeth
This is the official website of the UCI Political Science Methods and Coding Group. Welcome!

articles.title: R Resources
articles.contents: This page is in progress, please refer to the link here to our Github organization. All of the content is freely accessible to UCI Political Science Ph.D. Students, but requests for materials can also be made to [mmuch@uci.edu].

articles.contents:
